instruction.enter_numbers: Enter any two positive integers and click the 'Next' button.

addition.step_intro: Start adding from the Units column.
addition.step_normal_with_remember: Step {{step}}: {{d1}} + {{d2}} + {{carry}} = {{sum}}, since it's greater than 10, write {{resultDigit}} and carry over {{carryOut}}.
addition.step_normal_with_carry: Step {{step}}: {{d1}} + {{d2}} = {{sum}}, since it's greater than 10, write {{resultDigit}} and carry over {{carry}}.
addition.step_normal_no_carry: Step {{step}}: {{d1}} + {{d2}} = {{sum}}, write {{resultDigit}}, no need to carry.
addition.step_final_carry: Step {{step}}: All digits have been added, but there's still a carry of {{carry}}, so write it down in the next column.

subtraction.error_min_lt_sub: Cannot subtract: the minuend is smaller than the subtrahend.
subtraction.step_intro: Let's perform subtraction step by step!
subtraction.step_borrow_1: Step {{step}} (column {{label}}): {{a}} is less than {{b}}, so need to BORROW a dozen (10) to {{adjustedA}}. Need to PAY a dozen (10) in the next column.
subtraction.step_payback: (Paying back 1 borrowed in the previous step to {{b}})
subtraction.remember_borrowing: Remember, if there isn’t enough to subtract, you must borrow 1 from the next column!

multiplication.step_intro: Step {{step}}: Multiply the {{label}} digit of the multiplier by each digit of the multiplicand from right to left.
multiplication.step_zero_rule: Each time we multiply, the result shifts one column to the right!
multiplication.first_add_note: Finally, we add all partial products together.
multiplication.step_final_carry: Final carry: write {{carry}} to the highest place value.
multiplication.step_final_title: Final step: Add all partial products column by column:
multiplication.shift_zero: Since this is the {{label}} digit, we add one zero at the end of the result.
multiplication.step_detail_final: Since this is the last digit in this multiplication row, we write the full result: {{d1}} × {{d2}} = {{product}}
multiplication.step_carry_final_add: Then add the carry from the previous step: {{product}} + {{carry}} = {{sum}} → write {{nextDigit}}, carry {{nextCarry}}
multiplication.step_carry_final_add_last: {{product}} plus carry {{carry}} equals {{sum}} → write {{sum}}, no further carry since this is the last digit of {{d2}} x {{str1}}.

error.invalid_input: Please enter a valid positive integer.

step1_description: Write {{number1}} and {{number2}} so that the digits align in columns.
step1_subText: Press (Next) to see detailed calculation steps.
add_description: Align the numbers correctly in columns and add from right to left.
sub_description: Align the numbers correctly in columns and subtract from right to left.
mul_description: We will multiply {{number1}} by {{number2}} from right to left, one digit at a time.
div_description: Divide {{number1}} by {{number2}}, starting from the leftmost digit.

speech.selectOperator: You selected {{operator}}. Please enter a new number.

step_main: Step {{step}}: {{current}} divided by {{divisor}} equals {{result}}. Write {{result}} in the quotient. {{result}} × {{divisor}} = {{sub}}, then subtract: {{current}} - {{sub}} = {{remainder}}.
step_divide: Step {{step}}: Divide {{current}} by {{divisor}}. Since {{divisor}} × {{result}} = {{product}}, which is equal to or close to {{current}}, we write {{result}} in the quotient.
step_compare_less: Step {{step}}: {{current}} is smaller than {{divisor}}, so we cannot divide yet.
explanation.greater_equal: we can divide, so we begin the division.
step_smaller_write_zero: Step {{step}}: {{current}} is less than {{divisor}}, write 0 in the quotient.
step_cannot_divide: Step {{step}}: {{dividend}} is less than {{divisor}}, so we cannot divide. Write 0 in the quotient.
less_then_bring_down: Step {{step}}: We write {{result}} in the quotient.
step_bring_down: Step {{step}}: Bring down one more digit, which is {{nextDigit}}, resulting in {{afterBringDown}}.
step_bring_down_after_subtract: Step {{step}}: After subtracting, we automatically bring down one or more digits, here {{nextDigit}}, resulting in {{afterBringDown}} to continue dividing.
step_bring_down_extra: Step {{step}}: Then bring down another digit, which is {{nextDigit}}, getting {{afterBringDown}}.
step_down_to_number_two: Step {{step}}: Bring down {{nextDigit}}, we get {{afterBringDown}} to continue dividing.
